tank.name: Tetra Starter Line 54L
tank.notes: Internal filter with sponge and bio balls, 50W heater, LED lighting with blue/white modes. Substrate stack of Fluval Stratum capped with sand and gravel.

residents.label: Cryptocoryne affinis
residents.notes: Foreground to midground rooted in substrate (two plants).

residents.label: Anubias nana
residents.notes: Epiphyte attached to driftwood and rocks.

residents.label: Marimo moss ball
residents.notes: Pair placed on substrate as ornamental features.

residents.label: Hygrophila siamensis
residents.notes: Split the stems into left and right background groupings to create height.

events.notes: Filled with ~20 L reverse osmosis water topped up with Bologna tap water. Dosed Tetra AquaSafe conditioner and Tetra FilterActive bacteria starter.
Arranged driftwood centerpiece with decorative grey stones before planting.
Planted Cryptocoryne affinis in the substrate, secured two Anubias nana to wood/rocks, and placed two Marimo moss balls. Added Tetra PlantaStart tablets near roots.
Removed rockwool, trimmed damaged leaves, and planted clumps on both back corners for fast-growing background cover.

photos.caption: Hazy initial fill with freshly planted crypts and Anubias
Water clearing but still reading zero ammonia
Background Hygrophila siamensis filling in both back corners
